snippet: Tim Duncan scored 24 points and the Spurs opened the season with a victory over the New Orleans Hornets in Anthony Davis’s pro debut.

headline.main: In Anthony Davis’s N.B.A. Debut, Duncan and Spurs Prevail
headline.print_headline: In Anthony Davis’s N.B.A. Debut, Duncan and Spurs Prevail

snippet: A decision to fire Scott Forstall, the leader of mobile software development, means the departure of a high-ranking proponent of the visual design style for software favored by Steve Jobs.
abstract: Management shake-up at Apple will likely mean a shift away from visual software tricks that mimic real-world materials, aesthetic long championed by Steven P Jobs; shift toward more minimal style could significantly impact company, which puts design at center of its identity.

headline.main: Apple Shake-Up Could Lead to Design Shift
headline.print_headline: Apple Shake-Up Could Mean End to Real-World Images in Software

byline.original: By NICK WINGFIELD and NICK BILTON

snippet: Apps from the Internet Movie Database, Fandango and Apple prepare moviegoers for Oscar season.
abstract: Kit Eaton App Smart column reviews several apps from the Internet Movie Database, Fandango and Apple that keep moviegoers informed during Oscar season.

headline.main: Movie Showtimes and Reviews, Never Out of Arm’s Reach
headline.print_headline: Movie Showtimes and Reviews, Never Out of Arm’s Reach

snippet: There are plenty of ways to sift the information you receive from friends on Facebook and Twitter, like cutting back on updates from some friends without those friends finding out.
abstract: Tool Kit column offers advice on how to regulate the often overwhelming flood of updates from social networking sites like Facebook and Twitter.

headline.main: Relief Valves for Flooded Social Networks
headline.print_headline: Relief Valves for Flooded Social Networks

snippet: The technology reporters and editors of The New York Times scour the Web for important and peculiar items. Wednesday's selection includes professional photographs of the storm via cellphone and Instagram, a collection of devices useful in emergenc...
abstract: The technology reporters and editors of The New York Times scour the Web for important and peculiar items. Wednesday's selection includes professional photographs of the storm via cellphone and Instagram, a collection of devices useful in emergencies and a woman's argument that BlackBerrys are friendly to long nails.

headline.main: Today's Scuttlebot:  BlackBerry Women, and Ghost-Hunting Tech

snippet: As the city struggles to come back online in the aftermath of Hurricane Sandy, New York start-ups and companies get creative about going back to work.
abstract: As the city struggles to come back online in the aftermath of Hurricane Sandy, New York start-ups and companies get creative about going back to work.

headline.main: New York Start-Ups Become Officemates in Hurricane Sandy Aftermath
headline.print_headline:
Forming Bonds
In Seeking Place
To Get Online

snippet: Taking a comical swipe at Apple's latest offering, the iPad Mini, Conan O'Brien made a spoof video of Apple's announcing even more iPads that are slightly smaller and larger than the current offerings.
abstract: Taking a comical swipe at Apple's latest offering, the iPad Mini, Conan O'Brien made a spoof video of Apple's announcing even more iPads that are slightly smaller and larger than the current offerings.

headline.main: Meet the iPad Mini Mega, From Conan O'Brien

snippet: New cultural spaces, ranging from art galleries to film centers, provide incentive for tourists and Parisians to venture beyond the city limits.
abstract: New cultural spaces, ranging from art galleries to film centers, provide incentive for tourists and Parisians to venture beyond the city limits.

snippet: Apple quietly delayed the release of its latest upgrade to iTunes, saying it needed more time to "get it right."
abstract: Apple quietly delayed the release of its latest upgrade to iTunes, saying it needed more time to "get it right."

snippet: The upgrade, said to be the most significant in the 11-year life of the program, was supposed to come in October. Now the plan is November, Apple says, so it can "get it right."
abstract: The upgrade, said to be the most significant in the 11-year life of the program, was supposed to come in October. Now the plan is November, Apple says, so it can "get it right."

headline.main: Digital Notes: Apple Delays Latest iTunes Upgrade
